thread.title: Alabama Legislature special session to end without budget
thread.title_full: Alabama Legislature special session to end without budget

title: Alabama Legislature special session to end without budget
text:
Alabama Legislature's special session to end without general fund budget 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 8/11/15 1:12 pm EDT - Updated: 8/11/15 1:16 pm EDT 
MONTGOMERY, Alabama â€” Alabama lawmakers will end a special session without a budget as a political chasm widens between Republicans in the state House of Representatives and Senate. 
Tuesday is the final day of the special session. Legislators spent part of the day squabbling over bills that died or that lawmakers are trying get passed on the last day. 
The House on Monday voted down Senate-passed budget cuts by an overwhelming 92-2 vote. 
House Speaker Mike Hubbard says he is urging Gov. Robert Bentley to give lawmakers some time to work out an agreement before calling a second special session. 
Republican Senate President Pro Tem Del Marsh says he is baffled that some House members seemed angry at the Senate since House members did not approve any revenue bills.
